HWAGWAWOONG

There is no definitive answer to this question, as the meaning of hwagwawoong may vary depending on who you ask. Some people might interpret it as a word used to describe someone who is happy and content, while others might see it as a term of endearment. Ultimately, the meaning of hwagwawoong is up to the individual.

4-6 servings 1 hour
THIS IS AN ADVERT

Equipment

  • Large bowl
  • Steamer

Ingredients

  • Soybean paste
  • Sugar
  • Rice flour
  • Water
  • Salt
  • Green onions
  • Garlic
  • Ginger
  • Pepper

Directions

  1. In a large bowl, mix together the soybean paste, sugar, rice flour, water, salt, green onions, garlic, ginger, and pepper.
  2. Place the mixture in a steamer and steam for 1 hour.
  3. Allow the hwagwawoong to cool before serving.
